Pre-Game Insights: David Lesky writes about how the Royals' mindset could change now that they are in a sprint towards the post-season.

The Royals don't play more than six games in a row the rest of the season. You can still look big picture in many of the final 21 games, but there are probably three to six games in this stretch that will determine so much about the rest of 2024, and now is the time to take the throttle off and play them like playoff games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Athletics claimed infielder CJ Alexander off waivers from the Royals.
The Royals designated catcher Austin Nola for assignment and outrighted him to Omaha.
Others: Mike Petriello at MLB.com writes that Bobby Witt Jr. could have one of the best non-MVP seasons ever.
Javier Vaz has had a strong season in 2024. His power output has cooled, posting just a.387 slugging percentage this season.
